src:
Puerto Rico: Challenger para Capiovi

04 Nov 2019, 16:00



Foto: Norma Traid.

La ciudad de Capioví se adjudicó la Copa Challenger del 34° Torneo Internacional Carlos Culmey que se jugó del 1 al 3 de noviembre en Puerto Rico. Los deportistas que representaron a la ciudad acumularon mayor cantidad de puntos respecto a las otras delegaciones y de esa manera ganaron la copa general.“Por primera vez la challenger en casa” dijo el intendente Alejandro Arnhold, quien a su vez manifestó estar especialmente “agradecido a todos por el compromiso con las disciplinas en la que les tocó estar en competencia”.El torneo albergó a más de 2.000 deportistas que llegaron desde localidades de Santa Catarina y San Francisco do Sul (Brasil) y de Montecarlo, Ruiz de Montoya y Capioví (Argentina).Los visitantes compitieron en futbol 11, futbol 7 master y veteranos, futsal masculino y femenino, bochas masculino y femenino, bowling masculino y femenino, maraton masculino y femenino, voley masculino y femenino, beach voley masculino y femenino, tenis de mesa masculino.La fiesta de premiación se realizó el domingo a la tarde en el salón de fiestas del Club Victoria de Puerto Rico. text:
Puerto Rico: Challenger for Capiovi

04 Nov 2019, 16:00



Photo: Norma Traid.

The city of Capioví won the Challenger Cup of the 34th Carlos Culmey International Tournament which was played from November 1 to 3 in Puerto Rico. The athletes who represented the city accumulated more points compared to the other delegations and thus won the general cup. "For the first time the challenger at home" said Mayor Alejandro Arnhold, who in turn said he was especially "grateful to all for the commitment to the disciplines in which they had to be in competition. ”The tournament hosted more than 2,000 athletes who arrived from locations in Santa Catarina and San Francisco do Sul (Brazil) and Monte-Carlo, Ruiz de Montoya and Capioví (Argentina) The visitors competed in soccer 11, soccer 7 master and veterans, male and female futsal, male and female bowling, male and female bowling, male and female marathon, male and female volleyball, male and female beach volleyball, tennis men's table. The awards party was held Sunday afternoon in the party room of the Victoria Club of Puerto Rico.
